intro: Brachystelma swazicum, commonly known as the Swazi starling cactus, is a small, succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and star-shaped, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink. It is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its compact size and ornamental appeal.
